arguments.name: Cost
arguments.description: The initial cost of the asset.

arguments.name: Salvage
arguments.description: The value at the end of the depreciation (sometimes called the salvage value of the asset). This value can be 0.

arguments.name: Life
arguments.description: The number of periods over which the asset is depreciated (sometimes called the useful life of the asset).

arguments.name: Start_period
arguments.description: The starting period for which you want to calculate the depreciation. Start_period must use the same units as life.

arguments.name: End_period
arguments.description: The ending period for which you want to calculate the depreciation. End_period must use the same units as life.

arguments.name: Factor
arguments.description: The rate at which the balance declines. If factor is omitted, it is assumed to be 2 (the double-declining balance method). Change factor if you do not want to use the double-declining balance method. For a description of the double-declining balance method, see DDB.

arguments.name: No_switch
arguments.description: A logical value specifying whether to switch to straight-line depreciation when depreciation is greater than the declining balance calculation.
